author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Hello, I am an automated registration bot. I help manage the registration process by checking your registration against a set of [AutoMerge guidelines](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/). If all these guidelines are met, this pull request will be merged automatically, completing your registration. It is **strongly recommended** to follow the guidelines, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

## 1. New package registration

Please make sure that you have read the [package naming guidelines](https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1).

## 2. [AutoMerge Guidelines](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/) are all met! ✅

Your new package registration met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

## 3. To pause or stop registration

If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.

_Tip: You can edit blocking comments to add `[noblock]` in order to unblock auto-merging._

<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

My first reaction was: Given the names of the library in other languages, why the `DotOrg`? Wouldn't this package be perfectly fine as `QuadratureRules`?

But it unfortunately seems like there already is [QuadratureRules.jl](https://juliagni.github.io/QuadratureRules.jl/stable/). Maybe @michakraus can weight in on this? Does it make sense to have these two libraries, or would it be better to somehow combine efforts?

In any case, I would also recommend linking to or including the information in https://github.com/quadraturerules/quadraturerules/blob/main/website/pages/libraries/julia.md in the package README.

As far as I can see the code in the repo is auto-generated by some python code from the parent repo [quadraturerules](https://github.com/quadraturerules/quadraturerules) using tabulated coefficients.

While it is conceivable to generate code that is then used in [QuadratureRules.jl](https://github.com/JuliaGNI/QuadratureRules.jl), it is a bit against the spirit of the package. QuadratureRules.jl is intentionally not using tabulated coefficients but instead allows to compute all coefficients of a quadrature rule to arbitrary accuracy.
Okay… I still wonder if there’s a better name for this package. But if we can’t come up with anything, I’ll just unblock this and let the merge proceed

Maybe `TabulatedQuadratureRules`. That seems appropriate by itself, but of course no longer strongly connects to the source project. Alas, the source project name just isn’t available. Personally, the `DotOrg` rubs me the wrong way, and I would go with a more descriptive name. But ultimately, I think this is just going to be @mscroggs decision.
`TabulatedQuadratureRules` is a much better name than `DotOrg`. I'll update the name to that, thanks for the suggestion!
This can now be closed in favour of https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/124398

body:
